support_summary: ATXN3 contains two conserved LIR domains that directly interact with the autophagy adaptor LC3C, suggesting a regulatory role in the early stages of autophagy.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 directly interacts with the autophagy adaptor LC3C via LIR (LC3-interacting region) motifs in its Josephin domain. This interaction occurs on early autophagosomes.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 stimulates efficient autophagic flux. Depletion of ATXN3 leads to an accumulation of autophagosomes but a reduction in autophagic degradation, suggesting ATXN3 prevents superfluous initiation to promote effective autophagy.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds LC3C on early autophagosomes -> Superfluous autophagosome initiation is prevented -> Autophagic flux is promoted -> Efficient degradation of autophagic substrates
specific_effects: Depletion of ATXN3 in human cells causes a reduction in the autophagosomal degradation of proteins.
ATXN3 localizes to early autophagosomes but is not itself degraded by lysosomes.
